overall_summary: The reasoning process focused on handling a short time-series (96 hourly points) with clear daily seasonality. After evaluating multiple methods, the analysis selected a seasonal naive approach due to data length constraints, repeating the last observed daily pattern for the forecast period. The approach prioritized simplicity and recent patterns over complex modeling.
common_data_patterns: Potential missing values (though none in provided data)
key_insights: Data length (4 days) severely limits model complexity options
Recent daily patterns prioritized over historical averages
Explicit handling of hypothetical missing values in forecast requirements
Repetition of last observed season as baseline strategy
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with initial statistical model considerations (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing), ultimately simplifying to heuristic repetition due to data limitations and operational constraints.
